passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Ghostbusters is a 1984 American supernatural comedy film directed by Ivan Reitman. • The film stars Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, and Harold Ramis as eccentric parapsychologists who start a ghost-catching business in New York City. • The film's success led to the creation of a Ghostbusters franchise, including a 1989 sequel, Ghostbusters II. • The Ghostbusters franchise has expanded to include animated television series, comic books, and video games.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to introduce the Ghostbusters franchise to someone unfamiliar with it?

choices.A: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, and Harold Ramis starred as eccentric parapsychologists in the 1984 film Ghostbusters.
choices.B: The Ghostbusters franchise, originating from the 1984 supernatural comedy film, has expanded to include sequels, animated television series, comic books, and video games.
choices.C: Ghostbusters II, released in 1989, was a sequel to the original Ghostbusters film.
choices.D: Ivan Reitman directed the 1984 film Ghostbusters, which was set in New York City.

explanation: B: 'The Ghostbusters franchise, originating from the 1984 supernatural comedy film, has expanded to include sequels, animated television series, comic books, and video games.' is the correct answer because it effectively introduces the franchise and provides an overview of its various components.
distractor_explanation: 'Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, and Harold Ramis starred as eccentric parapsychologists in the 1984 film Ghostbusters.' is incorrect because it only introduces the main characters of the original film and does not mention the franchise as a whole.
'Ghostbusters II, released in 1989, was a sequel to the original Ghostbusters film.' is incorrect because it only discusses one sequel and does not provide an overview of the entire franchise.

'Ivan Reitman directed the 1984 film Ghostbusters, which was set in New York City.' is incorrect because it only provides information about the director and setting of the original film, not the entire franchise.
